{{cpp/title|hash{{small|&lt;std::filesystem::path&gt;}}}}
{{cpp/filesystem/path/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=filesystem|since=c++17|
template&lt;&gt;
struct hash&lt;std::filesystem::path&gt;;
}}

The template specialization of {{lc|std::hash}} for {{lc|std::filesystem::path}} allows users to obtain hash values of {{lc|std::filesystem::path}}.

The {{c|operator()}} of this specialization is {{c/core|noexcept}}. For every {{lc|std::filesystem::path}} value {{tt|p}}, {{c|std::hash&lt;std::filesystem::path&gt;{}(p)}} is equal to {{c|std::filesystem::hash_value(p)}}.

This specialization was absent from the C++17 standard publication, see {{lwg|3657}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;cstddef&gt;
#include &lt;filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;unordered_set&gt;
namespace fs = std::filesystem;

void show_hash(fs::path const&amp; p)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::uppercase &lt;&lt; std::setw(16)
              &lt;&lt; std::hash&lt;fs::path&gt;{}(p) &lt;&lt; " : " &lt;&lt; p &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

int main()
{
    auto tmp1 = fs::path{"/tmp"};
    auto tmp2 = fs::path{"/tmp/../tmp"};
    assert(!(tmp1 == tmp2));
    assert(fs::equivalent(tmp1, tmp2));
    show_hash(tmp1);
    show_hash(tmp2);

    for (auto s : {"/a///b", "/a//b", "/a/c", "...", "..", ".", ""})
        show_hash(s);

    std::unordered_set&lt;fs::path, std::hash&lt;fs::path&gt;&gt; dirs{
        "/bin", "/bin", "/lib", "/lib", "/opt", "/opt", "/tmp", "/tmp/../tmp"};
    for (fs::path const&amp; p : dirs)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; p &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
6050C47ADB62DFE5 : "/tmp"
62795A58B69AD90A : "/tmp/../tmp"
FF302110C9991974 : "/a///b"
FF302110C9991974 : "/a//b"
FD6167277915D464 : "/a/c"
C42040F82CD8B542 : "..."
D2D30154E0B78BBC : ".."
D18C722215ED0530 : "."
               0 : ""
"/tmp/../tmp" "/opt" "/lib" "/tmp" "/bin"
}}
